derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via late Latin from Greek diarrhoia, from diarrhein 'flow through', from dia 'through' + rhein 'to flow'

entry.def: If someone has diarrhoea, a lot of liquid faeces comes out of their body because they are ill.

means.word_mean: 1. frequent and watery bowel movements; can be a symptom of infection or food poisoning or colitis or a gastrointestinal tumor
